    public class | source

    APIClient

    You can directly use an instance of this class. client

    Constructor Summary

    Public Constructor
    public

    constructor()

    Unlike original WebSocket it does not immediately open a connection.

    Public Constructors

    public constructor() source

    Unlike original WebSocket it does not immediately open a connection. Please call APIClient#open method to connect.

    Public Methods

    public addEventListener(type: String, listener: Function): Boolean source

    Adds an event listener for a certain type. Allowed types are: open, close and message.

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    type String
    listener Function

    Return:

    Boolean

    public close(): Promise source

    Closes WebSocket connection.

    Return:

    Promise

    If connection already closed, promise will be resolved with the close event.

    public open(): Promise source

    Opens WebSocket connection.

    Return:

    Promise

    If connection is already opened, promise will be resolved with the open event.

    public removeEventListener(type: String, listener: Function): Boolean source

    Removes an event listener for a certain type. Allowed types are: open, close and message.

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    type String
    listener Function

    Return:

    Boolean

    public sendRequest(data: Object, options: Object): Promise source

    Performs request and waits for response.

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    data Object

    Request data object.
    data.Path String

    Request path, relative to server root. API prefix will be prepended automatically.
    data.Method 'get' | 'post' | 'head' | 'delete' | 'options' | 'put' | 'trace' | 'connect'

    Request method.
    data.Headers Object
    • optional

    Request headers, key should be header field name, and value header field value. Authentication and debug headers will be added automatically, depending on current state.
    data.Body Object
    • optional

    Request body. If suitable for JSON transport (i.e. simple object), it will be automatically converted. Otherwise it will be sent as-is/raw, and request will fall back to XHR implicitly.
    data.Query Object
    • optional

    Request query parameters as a key/value pairs. Will be automatically encoded and appended to the request path.
    options Object
    • optional

    Request options object.
    options.requestId String | Number
    • optional
    • default:

    Request ID which will be echoed by the server.
    options.responseTimeout Number
    • optional

    Timeout for the response, will use global value by default.
    options.xhr Boolean
    • optional
    • default: false

    Determines if the request should be sent as XHR. It will be implicitly turned on if body is not suitable for JSON transport.
    options.apiPrefix String
    • optional
    • default: api/

    Path prefix for the API endpoints (XHR only).
    options.responseType 'json' | 'text' | 'document' | 'arraybuffer' | 'blob'
    • optional
    • default: text

    Expected XHR response type.
    options.onUploadProgress Function
    • optional

    Callback for upload progress (XHR only).

    Return:

    Promise

    public subscribe(message: Object, func: Function): Subscription source

    Subscribe to message type.

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    message Object
    message.path String
    • optional

    Regex string for matching the path of an endpoint.
    message.methods String[]
    • optional

    Methods on which to subscribe to.
    message.codes Number[]
    • optional

    HTTP codes on which to subscribe to.
    message.types String[]
    • optional

    Types on which to subscribe to.
    func Function

    Callback function which will be triggered when the message is received.

    Return:

    Subscription

    Subscription object.

    public unsubscribe(token: String[] | String): Boolean source

    Unsubscribe from a message type.

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    token String[] | String

    Subscription token(s) as returned by APIClient#subscribe.

    Return:

    Boolean
